Pull Request Overview
This PR adds timeout protection infrastructure to prevent CI pipeline hangs and improve pipeline stability. The implementation includes a 300-second timeout configuration for pytest tests and adds the pytest-timeout plugin as a dependency.

Key changes:

Added pytest timeout configuration with 300-second limit
Integrated pytest-timeout plugin dependency for individual test timeouts
Configured multi-layer timeout protection at the test framework level
Reviewed Changes
Copilot reviewed 2 out of 2 changed files in this pull request and generated 2 comments.

File    Description
pytest.ini    Adds pytest configuration with 300-second timeout and test discovery settings
mvp_site/requirements.txt    Adds pytest-timeout>=2.4.0 dependency for timeout functionality

Bug: Incorrect Section Header Breaks Pytest Configuration
The pytest.ini file uses [tool:pytest] as its section header. This format is for pyproject.toml files, while pytest.ini requires [pytest]. As a result, pytest ignores all configuration settings, making the timeout protection infrastructure ineffective.

Fix in Cursor Fix in Web

  Task 1 - Code Quality Hook

  From the gist, I see you want a PostToolUse hook for Edit/MultiEdit/Write operations. Questions:
  - What specific linting tools should this hook run? (ruff, black, prettier, etc.)
Everything
  - What file types should trigger this hook? (Python only, or JS/TS/etc.?)
Python, js, html, ts
  - Should it run in project root or detect the appropriate subdirectory?
Whatever works the best
  - What should happen if linting fails? (Block the operation, just warn, auto-fix?)
Auto fix and warn

  Task 2 - Home Directory Scripts Support

  You mention git-header doesn't work properly from ~. Questions:
  - Which specific scripts are failing from ~/.claude/?
Test them all

Doesn't expect to be run in ~

Discovery
  - Are these personal scripts or should they work globally?
Globally

  Task 3 - "Absolutely Right" Hook + Grafana

  - What exactly triggers the "absolutely right" condition? (specific phrases Claude says?)
Yes. Run /research. It's a known issue when Claude makes a mistake and you correct it, it then says "You're absolutely right"

All 3

It's never normal. Absolutely right means Claude screwed up. Do /research for other similar phrases

Look at the codebase and suggest. Docs/ tmp/ .playwright, basically folders where output should be written

All test agents in .claude/agents

Block

⚠️ Potential issue

Enforce branch constraints with preflight, runtime guards, and failure handling.

Right now this section states policy but lacks executable guardrails. Add explicit checks that hard-fail on violations.

 ## 🚨 PR BRANCH CONSTRAINTS - MANDATORY

 **CRITICAL: STAY ON EXISTING PR BRANCH**
@@
 **BRANCH DISCIPLINE PROTOCOL:**
 - **Before execution**: Verify current branch matches target PR
 - **During execution**: All commits stay on same branch
 - **After execution**: Push updates to same PR, never create new PR

+**GUARDRAILS & ENFORCEMENT (REQUIRED):**
+- Preflight:
+  - Resolve PR number and target branch via GitHub API.
+  - Verify `git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD` == PR branch; abort if mismatch.
+  - Refuse to run if there is any uncommitted worktree state that could trigger unintended branch ops.
+- Runtime:
+  - Disallow any command that opens a new PR (e.g., `/pushl --create-pr`); abort with error.
+  - Block `git checkout -b`, `git switch -c`, or branch-renaming commands.
+  - Ensure all pushes target the PR branch and the same PR number.
+- Failure handling:
+  - If any guard triggers, stop immediately, post a PR comment with the violation details, and exit `FAILURE`.
📝 Committable suggestion
🤖 Prompt for AI Agents

Summary
Implement comprehensive Slack notification system for Claude Code that sends notifications when work is completed and Claude is awaiting the next instruction.

Key benefits:

Reduces context switching during development
Enables async workflow patterns where developers can work on other tasks
Provides team awareness of development progress
Zero-cost implementation using Slack's free webhook tier
Features
✅ Slack Webhook Integration: Secure integration via environment variables
✅ Rich Context Notifications: Includes repository name, current branch, and timestamp
✅ Graceful Degradation: Works seamlessly when webhook URL not configured
✅ Comprehensive Documentation: Complete setup guide with troubleshooting
✅ Testing Utilities: Verification script to validate setup

Implementation Details
Files Added:
scripts/slack_notify.sh: Core notification script with error handling and JSON escaping
scripts/slack_setup_guide.md: Complete setup documentation with step-by-step instructions
scripts/test_slack_notification.sh: Setup verification utility
Files Modified:
.claude/settings.json: Added Stop hook configuration for Slack notifications
Hook Integration:
Integrates with Claude Code's existing hook system via the "Stop" event
Triggers when Claude Code completes work and waits for next command
Uses existing hook infrastructure for reliability and consistency
Setup Process (5 minutes)
Create Slack App at api.slack.com/apps
Enable Incoming Webhooks
Set SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL environment variable
Test with ./scripts/test_slack_notification.sh
Example Notification
✅ Claude Code: Work completed - awaiting next instruction

📁 Repository: worktree_roadmap
🌿 Branch: feature/slack-notifications
⏰ Time: 2024-12-21 14:30:15
Security Considerations
Webhook URL stored as environment variable (never committed)
Script validates input and uses proper JSON escaping
Graceful handling when webhook not configured
No sensitive information included in notifications
Test Plan
 Script executes without errors when SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL is set
 Script gracefully handles missing SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL
 Notifications include correct repository and branch context
 JSON escaping prevents injection issues
 Documentation covers all setup scenarios
 Test script validates complete setup
Future Enhancements
This implementation provides foundation for additional notification triggers:

PostToolUse hook for major operations
Custom hooks for specific development events
Integration with other communication platforms

@chatgpt-codex-connector chatgpt-codex-connector bot 1 hour ago
[P1] Detect Slack HTTP failures before declaring success

The notifier prints ✅ Slack notification sent successfully whenever curl runs, but the request is executed without --fail or any status-code check (curl … --silent --show-error "$SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL"). Slack returns 404/410 when a webhook is revoked or the URL is mistyped, yet curl still exits with code 0, so the hook reports success while the message is discarded. Consider adding --fail (or inspecting the HTTP status) so that invalid or expired webhooks surface as errors instead of silently dropping notifications.

Useful? React with 👍 / 👎.

Copilot AI
1 hour ago
HTTP 4xx/5xx responses from Slack will not be treated as failures because curl is not using --fail or --fail-with-body; the error handler will never trigger for non-2xx responses. Add --fail-with-body (or --fail) so non-2xx statuses cause a non-zero exit.

Copilot uses AI. Check for mistakes.

curl -X POST -H 'Content-type: application/json' \
    --data "{\"text\":$(printf '%s' "$FULL_MESSAGE" | jq -Rs .)}" \
Copilot AI
1 hour ago
The script hard-depends on jq but doesn't check for it; if jq is missing, this command substitution will fail and the hook may error out. Add a preflight check (e.g., if ! command -v jq >/dev/null 2>&1; then echo "⚠️ jq not found; skipping Slack notification"; exit 0; fi) before using jq, or provide a small fallback JSON escaper.

Copilot uses AI. Check for mistakes.

@jleechan2015    Reply...
.claude/settings.json
        "hooks": [
          {
            "type": "command",
            "command": "bash -c 'if git rev-parse --is-inside-work-tree >/dev/null 2>&1; then ROOT=$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel); [ -x \"$ROOT/scripts/slack_notify.sh\" ] && exec \"$ROOT/scripts/slack_notify.sh\" \"✅ Claude Code: Work completed - awaiting next instruction\"; fi; exit 0'",
Copilot AI
1 hour ago
Using exec means any non-zero exit from slack_notify.sh (e.g., transient network failure) will propagate and can mark the hook as failed. To keep this hook non-blocking, drop exec and append || true to the call so failures don't affect the Stop event: [ -x "$ROOT/scripts/slack_notify.sh" ] && "$ROOT/scripts/slack_notify.sh" "…" || true.

Suggested change
            "command": "bash -c 'if git rev-parse --is-inside-work-tree >/dev/null 2>&1; then ROOT=$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel); [ -x \"$ROOT/scripts/slack_notify.sh\" ] && exec \"$ROOT/scripts/slack_notify.sh\" \"✅ Claude Code: Work completed - awaiting next instruction\"; fi; exit 0'",
            "command": "bash -c 'if git rev-parse --is-inside-work-tree >/dev/null 2>&1; then ROOT=$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel); [ -x \"$ROOT/scripts/slack_notify.sh\" ] && \"$ROOT/scripts/slack_notify.sh\" \"✅ Claude Code: Work completed - awaiting next instruction\" || true; fi; exit 0'",

jleechan2015
jleechan2015 commented 1 hour ago
Summary
Implement comprehensive Slack notification system for Claude Code that sends notifications when work is completed and Claude is awaiting the next instruction.

Key benefits:

Reduces context switching during development
Enables async workflow patterns where developers can work on other tasks
Provides team awareness of development progress
Zero-cost implementation using Slack's free webhook tier
Features
✅ Slack Webhook Integration: Secure integration via environment variables
✅ Rich Context Notifications: Includes repository name, current branch, and timestamp
✅ Graceful Degradation: Works seamlessly when webhook URL not configured
✅ Comprehensive Documentation: Complete setup guide with troubleshooting
✅ Testing Utilities: Verification script to validate setup

Implementation Details
Files Added:
scripts/slack_notify.sh: Core notification script with error handling and JSON escaping
scripts/slack_setup_guide.md: Complete setup documentation with step-by-step instructions
scripts/test_slack_notification.sh: Setup verification utility
Files Modified:
.claude/settings.json: Added Stop hook configuration for Slack notifications
Hook Integration:
Integrates with Claude Code's existing hook system via the "Stop" event
Triggers when Claude Code completes work and waits for next command
Uses existing hook infrastructure for reliability and consistency
Setup Process (5 minutes)
Create Slack App at api.slack.com/apps
Enable Incoming Webhooks
Set SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL environment variable
Test with ./scripts/test_slack_notification.sh
Example Notification
✅ Claude Code: Work completed - awaiting next instruction

📁 Repository: worktree_roadmap
🌿 Branch: feature/slack-notifications
⏰ Time: 2024-12-21 14:30:15
Security Considerations
Webhook URL stored as environment variable (never committed)
Script validates input and uses proper JSON escaping
Graceful handling when webhook not configured
No sensitive information included in notifications
Test Plan
 Script executes without errors when SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL is set
 Script gracefully handles missing SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL
 Notifications include correct repository and branch context
 JSON escaping prevents injection issues
 Documentation covers all setup scenarios
 Test script validates complete setup
Future Enhancements
This implementation provides foundation for additional notification triggers:

PostToolUse hook for major operations
Custom hooks for specific development events
Integration with other communication platforms
🤖 Generated with Claude Code

@chatgpt-codex-connector chatgpt-codex-connector bot 1 hour ago
[P1] Detect Slack HTTP failures before declaring success

The notifier prints ✅ Slack notification sent successfully whenever curl runs, but the request is executed without --fail or any status-code check (curl … --silent --show-error "$SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL"). Slack returns 404/410 when a webhook is revoked or the URL is mistyped, yet curl still exits with code 0, so the hook reports success while the message is discarded. Consider adding --fail (or inspecting the HTTP status) so that invalid or expired webhooks surface as errors instead of silently dropping notifications.

Useful? React with 👍 / 👎.

Pull Request Overview
Adds a Slack notification flow triggered by Claude Code’s Stop hook to inform developers when work completes and Claude is awaiting the next instruction.

Introduces a Slack webhook notification script with repository/branch/timestamp context
Wires the script into the Stop hook in .claude/settings.json
Provides setup guide and a test script to validate configuration

curl -X POST -H 'Content-type: application/json' \

Copilot AI
1 hour ago
HTTP 4xx/5xx responses from Slack will not be treated as failures because curl is not using --fail or --fail-with-body; the error handler will never trigger for non-2xx responses. Add --fail-with-body (or --fail) so non-2xx statuses cause a non-zero exit.

Copilot uses AI. Check for mistakes.

@jleechan2015    Reply...
scripts/slack_notify.sh
Comment on lines +37 to +38
curl -X POST -H 'Content-type: application/json' \
    --data "{\"text\":$(printf '%s' "$FULL_MESSAGE" | jq -Rs .)}" \
Copilot AI
1 hour ago
The script hard-depends on jq but doesn't check for it; if jq is missing, this command substitution will fail and the hook may error out. Add a preflight check (e.g., if ! command -v jq >/dev/null 2>&1; then echo "⚠️ jq not found; skipping Slack notification"; exit 0; fi) before using jq, or provide a small fallback JSON escaper.

Copilot uses AI. Check for mistakes.

@jleechan2015    Reply...
.claude/settings.json
        "hooks": [
          {
            "type": "command",
            "command": "bash -c 'if git rev-parse --is-inside-work-tree >/dev/null 2>&1; then ROOT=$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel); [ -x \"$ROOT/scripts/slack_notify.sh\" ] && exec \"$ROOT/scripts/slack_notify.sh\" \"✅ Claude Code: Work completed - awaiting next instruction\"; fi; exit 0'",
Copilot AI
1 hour ago
Using exec means any non-zero exit from slack_notify.sh (e.g., transient network failure) will propagate and can mark the hook as failed. To keep this hook non-blocking, drop exec and append || true to the call so failures don't affect the Stop event: [ -x "$ROOT/scripts/slack_notify.sh" ] && "$ROOT/scripts/slack_notify.sh" "…" || true.

Suggested change
            "command": "bash -c 'if git rev-parse --is-inside-work-tree >/dev/null 2>&1; then ROOT=$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel); [ -x \"$ROOT/scripts/slack_notify.sh\" ] && exec \"$ROOT/scripts/slack_notify.sh\" \"✅ Claude Code: Work completed - awaiting next instruction\"; fi; exit 0'",
            "command": "bash -c 'if git rev-parse --is-inside-work-tree >/dev/null 2>&1; then ROOT=$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel); [ -x \"$ROOT/scripts/slack_notify.sh\" ] && \"$ROOT/scripts/slack_notify.sh\" \"✅ Claude Code: Work completed - awaiting next instruction\" || true; fi; exit 0'",
